website_summaries.verdict: This mid-priced slow cooker will do the job, but it may overcook food. The probe function could help with this problem.
pros: Many great features, including programmable time and temperature
Insert and lid are dishwasher safe
cons: Gasket lid is hard to seat

website_summaries.verdict: The beauty of this affordable slow cooker is its simplicity. It sticks to the basics but also boasts extras that set it apart from the competition.
pros: Thanks to its excellent heat retention, lid clips, and spoon rest, the Hamilton Beach Set 'n Forget 6-Quart Programmable Slow Cooker  travels incredibly well
It's also a great value at $59.99
cons: The display panel design is a little dated, and the button configuration could be more intuitive
It also lacks some design touches that make its competitors easier to carry and store

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is garbage and the customer service is HORRIBLE. I received this, filled it with a roast and everything to accompany it. Hit manual, low, it beeped, I walked out the door. When I returned from work everything was room temp and spoiled. This thing doesn't warm up no matter what I do. Tried to reach out to customer service and i'm on my 4th email after providing the model and series number for them on multiple occasion they still continue to ask for more information. This is a terrible product. No more Hamilton Beach ANYTHING for this family. I suggest you stay away from this at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan K.

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach pots have declined in quality over the past ...
customer_reviews.text: Hamilton Beach pots have declined in quality over the past few years. The cycling temperature causes the internal pot to crack rapidly - first pot I thought I had left it on too long too high, second I watched carefully and could see the resulting cracking. Moving away from this brand completely.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Whole stainless steel outside collapsed on one side upon using for the first time!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this same crockpot for 15 years and loved it so much that I recently decided to purchase a second one. The quality has certainly declined since I bought my first one 15 years ago. Upon removing from packaging it seemed great until I used it for the first time! First time use the whole stainless steel outside collapsed in on one side after only being on low! I have just received a replacement one and praying this doesn’t happen again. I will update my review after first use of the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Huber

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Cord wraps up and stores on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: DiegoDozer

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but beware of auto shut off!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice slow cooker. The only thing I would change is the auto shut off after 14 hours. I use it for bone broth, which typically takes 36 - 48 hours. There should be a way to override this. The manual does warn about the auto shut off, but it's kind of buried at the end of each cooking mode section, so it's easy to miss. The first time I used it for a long broth cook, I woke up to a warm pot. Fortunately, it had only shut off an hour prior, so I was able to save to pot of liquid gold! Just be sure to stop and restart the cooker before going to bed. Overall, great cooker.
customer_reviews.author: LB14Review

customer_reviews.title: This was a dud and I would not buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.text: I used this once and loved it -- it worked great and the meal I made was stress free and delicious. I didn't use it for a few more weeks (and therefore I'm out of the 30-day return time) and it won't work! It comes on but when I push the "manual" button to begin the cooking, nothing happens. All the lights stay lit and trying different buttons, unplugging it and trying again, it doesn't work. Now I have to find a big enough box to return it and hope that the manufacturer will send me one that works more than once. VERY DISAPPOINTING. In fact, I may just buy another brand at a local store.
customer_reviews.author: Tanaka

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. And they will not help!
customer_reviews.text: The sticker face on the front came off almost immediately. I called and emailed and was told I wound have to pay to send it back and pay for a replacement. Um, no. Then just after a few uses, the digital display did something and is unreadable. It has only had a few uses within regular cooking guidelines and has never been wet. If you ask me, it’s just a cheaply made product. Not worth it! Now I’m on the market for a new crockpot and will steer clear of Hamilton Beach. Obviously they don’t stand by their products.
customer_reviews.author: Laura B. Knox

customer_reviews.title: Best crockpot ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love this crockpot (slow cooker) because you can cook large or small dishes by programming the cook time and temperature. I have cooked turkey roast, pork roasts, fish, and numerous vegetables with perfect results. The best part is the easy cleanup. Because the ceramic pot easily lifts from the cooker it can be rinsed in the sink and then placed in the dishwasher without any hassle. My old crockpot did not have a removable ceramic pot and was a nightmare to clean. I also love the temperature probe feature that allows you to cook large roasts or poultry and get consistently good results. The keep warm feature is super.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have this, I hate it
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to cook several things in it and it has ruined the food every time. I had not used a crock pot in a long time so I thought it was me, but no, it is the pot. It is the only crock pot I have even had with holes in the lid and I think this might be part of the problem because everything I cooked in it was dry and leathery, no matter the method I chose to cook with. If I had it all to do over I would buy an inexpensive pot with a removable liner and have good food in it like I used to from my old one.
customer_reviews.author: JaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - parts expensive - Probe Grommet fell out after very little use
customer_reviews.text: Although I am happy with the slow cooker (so far - not quite 6 months since purchase, used once or twice per month), one of the probe grommets fell out and disappeared. I have never used the probe. Seemed like a mfg defect to me so I called and after a long wait did reach a real person who informed me that the lid and grommets are not covered under the mfr warranty. The new grommet cost me 2.99 plus 9.35 for shipping. Given lack of warranty and expense of parts, this item is more expensive that it appears. Unfortunately this is not unique to this item or this company but the general state of things.
customer_reviews.author: Callisto

customer_reviews.title: Died after only a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. My first one DIED after 10 months (and a whole roast went to waste after coming home to raw meat.) they sent me a new one - I had to pay $14 shipping fee though. My neighbors died too but just over a year - past the warranty, and she's NOT happy. Sadly I'm expecting the second one to die too and I will be tossing it and forgetting. What a pice of junk - I can't wait to get a nicer one!. The front panel is like a sticker - so cheap, and I'm angry every time I have to push it for programming.
customer_reviews.author: Robin O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: A bacholors best kitchen companion.
customer_reviews.text: I relied on Consumers Report for this purchase and very glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: kenneth louk

customer_reviews.title: Might want to save your money
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a few times now and it seems ok. The stone ware is not completely coated which upset me and my probe never seems to work. It also seems to cook rather swiftly. Ultimate test will be when I go back to work but I'm also scared to leave it. I will update my review at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Mon G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Slow Cooker !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this slow cooker after much research and my old KitchenAid about to give it up, after 10+ years of excellent service. The Hamilton Beach Slow Cooker is very easy to use and offers digital programming, temperature probe or old fashion manual (High, Low and Warm) cooking options. The lock feature is nice when transporting your slow cooker creations. I use to use masking tape to secure the lid on my old cooker, when transporting my cooker to a party. The ceramic bowl is dish washer safe, which is a priority for me. If you are looking for a new slow cooker, at a great price, definitely consider this Hamilton Beach model
customer_reviews.author: MVSBOSS

customer_reviews.title: Horrible plastic smell no matter what
customer_reviews.text: I washed it with vinegar, hot water, lemon, baking soda, put it in the dishwasher, I left it overnight with all the ingredients mixed together and the horrible plastic smell and taste just won't go away. I'm not exaggerating but I washed the whole thing more than 10 times with all the products that you can imagine and nothing worked. I'm so disappointed since I love cooking and making new recipes. This purchase was definitely a waste of money and food.
customer_reviews.author: Fernanda Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off on its own!  Don't buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this slow cooker for a little over a year. Just had a group of 10 for dinner. Put expensive meat in early in the morning and left for the day. Returned and the slow cooker had shut off and meat was uncooked. Not only was it the cost of the meat in the crock pot but also had to purchase cooked food from a restaurant for 10 people! Ridiculous and very inconvenient! Afterwards I tried programming and each time after 10 minutes shuts off. Ended up being very costly, Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: I had such high hopes...
customer_reviews.text: It cooked pretty well, although it seemed to dry out meat if you use the probe and left it on warm for very long. My real problem is that the lid seems to be somewhat fragile and exploded the 4th time I cleaned it. Granted, I may have tapped it with the edge of the crock but even so, I've hit a lot of glass things in my life and haven't ever had anything like this happen. What really annoys me is that they don't warranty glass and they charge $20 for a replacement lid that doesn't have a probe hole, thus rendering the crock-pot useless for what I want.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: As far as slow cookers go this is up there with the best of them. It has features that I swore I would never use, yet here I find myself using the cooking probe the very first time I use it. The lid stays nicely closed and the seal helps it keep in the heat. It hard to image that these functions are available on a slow cooker. I was replacing one from 2007, it still worked yet was not good for precise cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Second time we used it, it went into an error mode sometime during the day, changed the temperature from low to high on its own and the keypad stopped working. Had to unplug it to get it to turn off. Plugged it back in later and it no longer works at all. Tried to call the manufacturer for help at 4:10 pm eastern time and was told by a recording that their office was closed and to call back during normal business hours 9am to 4:30 pm eastern time. I guess getting off early on a Friday is more important than customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Top Secret Joe

customer_reviews.title: Lid exploded!
customer_reviews.text: Well, it worked fine until the day the lid exploded while it was just sitting on the counter (empty, at room temperature), spraying glass all over the kitchen. It’s lucky I was standing far enough away that I wasn’t hit by flying glass. The slow cooker was only 9 months old and had been used maybe a dozen times. Based on the number of reports of exploding glass lids online, this is not an isolated case. Hamilton Beach helpfully told me the lid isn’t covered by warranty and I was welcome to buy a new one if I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Worst Product
customer_reviews.text: Bought in September new. Lasted till January. Worst quality. Digital controls a hazard and does not work half the time. Too late to return. We should have returned when we saw the controls were confusing and would not work. Do not buy. Hamilton Beach crockpots are the worst. This is the second one I went thru in 2 years. Customer service the worst and arrogant. Told me they could repair or replace for more money than I paid for it. Done with Hamilton Beach. Be prepared for 1 hour hold times on customer service. They even say its 5o minutes at beginning of hold. Very poor.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Drop in quality
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this crockpot quite awhile back. It's an excellent piece of cooking equipment. I especially liked using the temperature probe option. Unfortunately, the cable on the probe frayed over a the years of use and I ordered a replacement pot with probe. I noticed some of the reviews showed that Hamilton Beaches quality had degraded since I'd last purchased one and obseved this to be true when I received the new unit. I was able to use the new probe with the old crockpot. I'm now using the old one and keeping the new one on standby for replacement pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Dante Alighieri

customer_reviews.title: Kids submerged the last one :(
customer_reviews.text: Perfect slow cooker. Kids washing dishes and apparently placed the unit down in the water and would no longer turn on and felt a little shaky about it anyway even if it had have turned back on.....Amazon to the rescue and time for that roast!!!! Just ordered a replacement and all was well again! Get you one if you don’t already have it. Price is great product is fantastic. Set and forget about it!
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, but Questionable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1) The top has a rubber gasket which forms a good seal for keeping in bubbling fluids. 2) The locks hold down the top well. 3) Manual temp probe works great! Cons: 1) The front screen started peeling off and bubbling after 2 uses... 2) The ceramic pot doesn't sit flush in the base, leading to uneven heating and hot spots. 3) Flimsy feel to the base.
customer_reviews.author: Buford Higgs

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach 6 Quart Digital Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: Came a little dented, though we straightened that out, and now I feel, after using it several times, that it gets five stars for a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: NormaRae

customer_reviews.title: Heating element at top? Burns and uneven cooking
customer_reviews.text: The heating element that warms the crock seems to be at the middle/top of the crock. If I’m trying to steam something or water bath something, the water doesn’t get hot, but the crock above the water does get hot. It’s super annoying for anything other than full slow cooker stews. This is even a problem for stews actually, I’ve had it dry out and burn beans at the top of the stew because the cooker doesn’t heat from below. I specifically bought an oval slow cooker for the versatility, but the heating element placement kills that plan. Also, the outside jacket of the metal slow cooker gets REALLY f’ing hot. Wouldn’t purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Best Crockpot I have owned! And I have had a few!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had a New Crockpot in a very long time. I am glad I chose this one. Let’s start with the lid!!! It is not your standard crockpot lid it has a seal that goes between the lid and the pot, it is not glass on the pot. Then there is the locking feature! Love this, easy to use especially when using your crockpot and transporting it. And it stays on the warning feature until you turn it off!!! With several options for programming. Cooks as the directions say it will!!! So glad I I finally got a New crockpot! Just not an Instapot kind of girl.
customer_reviews.author: C. Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Great features, but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems to work well, but it seems to be cheaply made. There are a lot of bumps and dents in the ceramic crock and rough edges on the various plastic pieces. The handle on the lid seems particularly cheap and I’m worried that it may not hold up to regular use. For the price, I’m pretty disappointed. However, I love that it has an attached thermometer- which I haven’t found in any other slow cookers- so I’m not sure if I’m going to keep it and hope that it’s more durable than it seems or just go ahead and return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kay C.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best crock pots ever
customer_reviews.text: We love the flexibility of this crock pot. We can set the temperature and time manually or use the probe for a wonderful dinner. Often it is loaded with vegetables, broth and a roast to cook low and slow all day. This tenderizes even the toughest cut of beef.
customer_reviews.author: noone

customer_reviews.title: i was not happy
customer_reviews.text: must be defective somehow it has never performed as i expected.i use many slow cookers and it just didnt make food like i am used to eating, not done right etc i appreciate that i can return it as i was unhappy with its performance i set it aside and forgot for awhile, and when i remembered it was much later than i should have notified you.. thank you for your customer service and i love your company
customer_reviews.author: barbara novack

customer_reviews.title: Love this slow cooker.
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this slow cooker. It's so simple to use. I love the features this slow cooker offers as well. There's nothing better than being able to throw something in it, set a timer, and know that after your timer goes off it will automatically set itself to warm for you. I would like to remind everyone that when you are done and go to put it up to not do what I did and put the thermometer under the bowl. I forgot I put it there and it melted. Put it inside the bowl if anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Hamilton Beach Set'n Forget Programmable Slow cooker is perfect for every household
customer_reviews.text: Hamilton Beach Set'n Forget Programmable Slow cooker is perfect for every household. As a working parent I love it that I can prepare a healthy meal for my family with minimal effort. This slow cooker is the ideal way to cook a meal when you are away from home because you can digitally set the temperature and the hours of cook time, once it is done cooking it automatically turns to warm, this way you come home to a warm home cooked meal no matter how long you are away from your home. Another valuable feature is the clamping lid that seals tightly to allow for spill proof transfer of your home cooked meal, ideal for holiday parties.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy a different slow cooker again
customer_reviews.text: My family and I have had a bunch of different slow cookers over the years. Most have been ok. Many have run too hot or too cold and ruined meals. This one is one of the best I have ever used. Cooks food consistently. The cooking probe is a god send. I have actually purchased two of these for special events I do. It is a fantastic product. Having the option to seal the top puts it in a league of its own. No more spilling soup or food all over yourself or car. I will definitely buy these for people as wedding gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks pretty but it’s junk
customer_reviews.text: This product is horrible. I have put it on high. For four hours and come back and food isn’t even warm yet. I also have put things on low that should not be heated up to much. Come back 15 minutes later and it’s boiling. Ruining everything that I put in it. Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin S

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need for a great price
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker is unstoppable. I've used it so much over the past few months. It does a great job at cooking, and is awesome for meal prep. The timer function is great. It can cook while I'm at work, then keep things warm and ready for when I get home. Cleans easily, simple to use. Haven't had a chance to use the temperature probe yet, but I imagine it would be helpful for cooking whole birds/other large meats.
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Check the product right away
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cooker back in October for a xmas gift. Decided to try it to make sure everything is ok with it only to find out its not working at all. Too late to return so now stuck with this useless cooker. Make sure you check it as soon as you get it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: use it a lot and really like it. My only complaint was that the little ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift at Christmas and it was well received. I have had one for years, use it a lot and really like it. My only complaint was that the little rubber o-ring that goes into the hole where the thermometer probe fell out quickly and I lost it. I use an aluminum foil ''plug' in the hole when cooking so I don't lose heat and moisture while in use.
customer_reviews.author: mammasawnT

customer_reviews.title: mostly plleased
customer_reviews.text: Came well pkged and prompt. Replaced my 10 year old crock pot that only has dial. This is a fun welcome pot, because it is program able for time, heat and to stay warm,after cook time. The 4 stars is because the lid does not sit tight even though it is heavy glass. The lid also has a slim gasket so should seal better than it looks after a couple uses i hope. Also the crock itself is really heavy but that is a good thing
customer_reviews.author: Wballen

customer_reviews.title: 6 Quart Slow Cooker Does The Job!
customer_reviews.text: Nice Large 6 Quart Slow Cooker from Hamilton Beach. Temperature probe works well through small venting hole in lid. Has nice locking claspse for traveling only not to cook with. Too short of a power cord 3 foot isnt long enough unless your outlet is very close to your counter. Programming and buttons are simple to use. I must say however there is a new oily electrical smell when cooking that I don't like. Even after multiple uses, I still smell it. Still though it cooks fine and does the job perfectly. Would recommend. 4 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: John Gale

customer_reviews.title: Great crock pot!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this crock pot I love the controls and the large display that has a good visibility. The electric cord is way too short so it will need an extender. I used the probe only once and found that if I go by the probe measurement I undercook the meat, in other words I had to cook it much longer. Doesn't bother me at all - overall I am pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniela

customer_reviews.title: Wedding gift for son and my new daughter
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June 2019 as a wedding gift. My son and his wife are very busy (as most folks these days) and use this slow cooker at least 4 times a week. They love it! My wife and I have the same brand, albeit 10 years older, and have had no issues. My new daughter is always telling us how it's the best gift they received. They have cooked small whole turkeys, too Irish stew, to chili, to chicken n dumplings, and all the normal type of stuff. Would recommend to anyone needing to have good, healthy, fresh meals ready when coming home from a long days work.
customer_reviews.author: BumbleBee

customer_reviews.title: Low setting is way too hot.
customer_reviews.text: I like this for cooking most things but some things i don't. even even on low, everything in the slow cooker boils no matter how liquidy or thick. i was doing homemade bbq sauce, weenies and meatballs because i had the random craving, left them on low for a few hours, string occasionally, went back a couple hours later and the sauce was still liquidy and still at the same level but EVERYTHING was black.. i could almost cook everything at what the low temp should be but on warm! irritated but ill just use warm instead of low, guess it doesn't have a true warm setting than since warm is equivalent to what low should be lol
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Tomei

customer_reviews.title: Great to have this in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT - have made pulled pork, pork ribs, pinto beans and stewed chicken with it. I have had crockpots in the past and nothing against that name brand, but I love all the features of this one and it was definitely worth the money. seemed true to temps. one thing i have learned is that you may have to prep (ie, sear, brown, etc) some of your ingredients prior to placing them into the cooker if you are expecting a home cooked flavor - but it's as good as cooking on the stove if you do it that way. It can't be beat for creating tender meat vs. stovetop though.
customer_reviews.author: beadlady

customer_reviews.title: I loved this slow cooker for 2 years and used it ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this slow cooker for 2 years and used it regularly for soup. I alway hand wash the ceramic pot. I found a huge crack on the bottom side of the ceramic pot and it is leaking inside the cooker staining it. I thought this cooker would last longer than 2 years. the most affordable place to buy replacement crock is 855-343-0069 The manufacture customer support telephone number.
customer_reviews.author: BRobinson

customer_reviews.title: Gasket Seal is Defective
customer_reviews.text: After only a half dozen uses after which we always thoroughly clean it, an odor developed in the lid gasket that is impossible to remove. Tried all the online tips, DW, vinegar soak, baking soda, etc. I suspect there is a defect where the gasket seats into the glass lid. Wanted to remove the gasket but was afraid it would tear. Can't reach anyone at HB customer service number.
customer_reviews.author: Avodomain

customer_reviews.title: front plastic housing around control panel is plastic and comes ...
customer_reviews.text: front plastic housing around control panel is plastic and comes in contact w/ hot heating element, causing plastic to melt, smell and come apart. this unit is a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Burns

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold temperature
customer_reviews.text: I bought this crock pot thinking it would hold a temperature of 175 and after following precise instructions it will not hold as it says it will. So disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Trenda R. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellent slow cooker!
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker is excellent. I ordered this to replace a very old Crock Pot that had its lid finally fell apart on. This seems to be very well made and heavy duty. I was worried about the probe hole letting out moisture, but I can't see anything escaping. This cooks to perfection, without getting too hot. When my old slow cooker was on warm mode, I could see the liquid boiling. This cooks AND warms to the proper temperature. The programmable timer is easy to use and handy. The rubber gasket and clips on the side are great features, as well, in case I need to transport food.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: A reliable cooker, and good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: We first ordered this slow cooker 4 years ago for a second home. It has worked well. The "manual," "program," and temperature probe work. The unit has sufficient capacity for larger recipes, and the lid clamps are sometimes convenient. Earlier this year, we ordered another of these cookers for our principal residence. I think that it's good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: I Love this Slow Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I hated my old crock pot, I always overcooked everything. With this slow cooker the probe lets you cook items to a selected temperature and will automatically put the cooker to the "warm" setting once cooking temperature is reached. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great features but disappointing construction
customer_reviews.text: I really like the keep warm feature. I can't always get home within the cooking time frame, so with this feature my food is never over cooked. I have to add something about the construction however. As much as I love this pot, it is starting to fall apart within the first year. The control panel cover has broken and the keypad now has a bubble under it. It still works, but I don't know for how long.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: This is the best slow cooker I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I make 4-5lbs pot roast twice a month as well as slow cooked whole chicken twice a month. This slow cooker has perfect settings and the ability to create manual settings and a warming feature. It s the best and most consistent piece of equipment in my kitchen. 5 stars all day!
customer_reviews.author: Jacer

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: Mine died (goodbye, $15 pork shoulder) in the middle of the night, exactly 12 months after purchase. Don't be tricked by the positive reviews, they were just made too early. Update: I contacted Hamilton Beach customer service and they honored my warranty even though I was outside the window. They were super helpful and friendly. You do have to pay to ship the replacement product, but I figured $15 shipping was better than paying for a brand new slow cooker, even if this one does only last another year. I have adjusted my star rating to reflect the positive experience I had with their customer service department.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Williams

customer_reviews.title: I will get my old one out of the attic!
customer_reviews.text: The control knobs, setting etc. are almost impossible to just turn to low, med or high. Hate those lock down things, the temp probe, all make it more difficult to clean and store. Seriously I have an old one with a slight crack in the crock. I will get it out of the attic and try to send this back. Bad recommendation from HotWire
customer_reviews.author: aepj

customer_reviews.title: Product was defective out of the box and the company after numerous emails refused to make good
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the product the entire bottom was incorrectly installed. The cooker wobbled on its base as one end of the bottom was outside the rim and the other end was inside the rim. The bolts were smooth and unable to be removed so that the bottom could be reset. The worst thing is that after numerous emails to customer service the company won't make good on this cooker that I had not yet used!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best of...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice quality slow cooker.... The temperature probe makes chicken easy to cook. I cook whole chickens to add to my dog's kibble every week. This takes all the guesswork out of the equation.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Bough this a while ago and have used at least 10-12 times with great results. Best feature ease of use. Pot does what it is supposed to do. Temp control is good and the automatic drop to "warm" after the cooking time has elapsed is great! Set it up and walk away. No need to babysit. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: A. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Best Slow Cooker I've Ever Had.
customer_reviews.text: It's so awesome! I love to cook while I'm at work and this is a reliable slow cooker that you can take places (another big plus). Large enough to cook a small turkey! I'm thrilled with my purchase. I read a lot of online cooking blogs and it's been recommended by home chefs many times so that was why I bought it....with confidence! The product does not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Vesna

customer_reviews.title: I like the sturdy crock liner - it has withstood bumps ...
customer_reviews.text: We own this Slow Cooker and purchased another as a Christmas Gift. You know you've done the right thing when the recipient hugs the box and gets teary-eyed! This is such a dependable unit - we've never had a problem of any kind with it and ours is at least 5 years old. I like the sturdy crock liner - it has withstood bumps in the sink or cabinet. Others have written more details but I can promise this unit has been the Best.

customer_reviews.title: Rubber gasket on lid is a problem
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I really liked the controls, that it is programmable to turn to heat after a set amount of time, and the idea of a temperature probe and a shape that could accommodate cooking meat. Unfortunately, it is very, very difficult to line up the lid with the food receptacle so that the slow cooker is sealed to keep the heat in. It looks like the lid is on, but there are gaps between the lid and the food receptacle. In addition, when the slow cooker is heated, the gasket makes a chemical smell that doesn't seem to affect the food but is noticeable in the kitchen environment. I am returning it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Nita D

customer_reviews.title: We LOVE This Thing!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT! Included thermometer lets you know that your food is at a safe temperature. The locking lid makes it perfect for transporting food to potlucks. If we had a bigger inverter, I think we could even keep it turned on in the car. (We tried with the dinky inverter that's built into my wife's car. It would work for about 30 minutes at a time before the inverter would shut itself down for a while.) There was a bit of a learning curve to figure out the controls, but if I can get it, anybody can.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Reed

customer_reviews.title: in good condition and for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: The item was delivered on time, in good condition and for a fair price. I gave it three stars because the glass lid has marks on the glass that won't come off - they look like hard water marks but resist any methods and products I've tried, to remove them. Didn't appear to have been a returned item by another purchaser, but I can't be sure. With this glass lid problem being the only complaint I have, I will say that in all other aspects, I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Great crock pot. The programmable cooking function and the probe function were almost exactly what I wanted. It would be great if the probe function could be used to heat to a temperature and then hold at that temperature for a programmed amount of time, but oh well. It's successful cooked a fantastic roasted chicken, a few soups, and some beef, with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dumah Roark

customer_reviews.title: Useful and a great value
customer_reviews.text: I knew I was a grown-up the day I began getting excited about slow cookers, but this one is worth getting excited about. The price is excellent for what it is - a fully programmable slow cooker, which means you can set it to cook for a certain number of hours and then switch over to warm. No more arriving home to find your pork ribs charred so badly they're sticking to the inside of the slow cooker (based on a true story, sadly). My wife and I have had great success with this, and you probably will too!
customer_reviews.author: J. Barringer

customer_reviews.title: Fast for a slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: I put in boneless chicken breasts and then the temp probe. It was really easy to set the whole thing up. I set the temp for 180 degrees and walked away. It was done and cooked to perfection in about an hour. Yes, an hour! Wow. I'm definitely going to be using this thing A LOT!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Vega

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Crock Pot for a busy family
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one I have bought! Used mine for over 3 years and loved it so much, bought one for a friend! The clamping lid makes it great to use for potlucks, and the digital timer is perfect for setting and forgetting. Use it at least twice a week for dinners at home. Set it up at 6 am, and whenever I get home I know dinner is ready and on warm setting. Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanine

customer_reviews.title: What is not to like about this item?
customer_reviews.text: What is not to like about this item? I love that it shifts to warm when done cooking so you can come home late and still have a healthy warm meal ready when you walk in the door. Very convenient. I've purchased one for each of my three daughters. I really like that you can latch down the lid if transporting the pot full of food. We warmed spicy meatballs in it and took it to another location for a party. Simply plugged it in at the destination.
customer_reviews.author: Jewelsmom

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift for my adult daughter. She's never used one before. She goes to school full-time during the day and works full-time at night. Now she doesn't have to stress about eating healthier. The slow cooker helps her eat better, and is ready when she gets home.
customer_reviews.author: Word to Dreams aka Wonderwmn

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got this.
customer_reviews.text: I like having this because I can have it cook all day and come home to dinner ready, I'm still trying to learn the in and out and tips for it. Food that shouldn't be soupy because of all the steam build up, but there's info online giving you pointers.
customer_reviews.author: Liz C.

customer_reviews.title: horrible smell
customer_reviews.text: some of the other reviews commented on this as well...but there is a rubber ring on the lid. while cooking it emits a horrible smell that carried onto the food. Returning to amazon- which is something I rarely do.
customer_reviews.author: sono girl

customer_reviews.title: Great slow cooker for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have had no issues with it getting overly hot on the outside. It cooks exactly like its supposed to. I purchased it in January and have not had any issues at all with it. If you are someone who cooks every day with one then maybe one of the more expensive types would be better but for someone like me who uses it maybe once a week this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the programmable features on this and the quick automatic settings
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these crockpots and have used and loved it for over 4 years so I bought this one for my mother. I love being able to quickly load ingredients, turn on, hit program and select time and high/medium or warm and run out the door. It cooks very reliably and the removable inner liner makes it easy to clean (or soak). Very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Retired software tester

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, great slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: We put this slow cooker to work right out of the box and it has been great from day one. The programming works exactly as described, and the cooking temperatures are perfect. 'High' is a steady simmer, 'Low' is a slow simmer, and 'Warm' is just warm enough for serving food hot. The crock is big, sturdy, and cleans easily. I really like the clips on the lid for carrying it without spilling. Also the probe is fantastic for roasts! For the price you aren't going to do better than this unit.
customer_reviews.author: snazzmo

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was recommended on several product review sites. The lid has a rubber seal which looks and feels to me like it is NOT going to last! The front temperature control also looks and feels cheap and does not look like it will last either! I bought this from the internet due to the fact that I could not find any store anywhere that carried it! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: David C. Reed

customer_reviews.title: SLOW COOKER
customer_reviews.text: I love this slow cooker. I had one just like it but it stopped working, so I bought another one just like it. Easy to transport food without anything spilling. Can fit large portions of food.
customer_reviews.author: LISA

customer_reviews.title: Great slow cooker!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. After too many slow cookers that were not right (temperature issues etc.) this one is great. Love the locking lid feature too!
customer_reviews.author: tualatinshopper

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: My old crock pot held four quarts. This holds six, so there's less chance of boiling over and making that impossible mess inside the heating chamber. The controls are easy to understand and to manipulate. The pot made my vegetable soup recipe perfectly. The clamp-down lid will be good for taking the pot to friends' homes.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Tramp

customer_reviews.title: Fairly priced , Does the Job all day , every day
customer_reviews.text: Does the job all day every day ... however for those cooking with this , heres a QUICK TIP : it takes a full 30 - 45 minutes to reach operating temperature , whatever time your recipe calls for add 30 minutes in your head ........ otherwise this thing works just fine that’s the only reason it got four stars out of five , at the same time I’m fully aware it wasn’t a $75 slow cooker either .... but , what you pay is what you get, Hamilton Beach put together a nice product here :)
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter soups and stews!
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking making soups and stews in this. I cook them about 2 hours less than recommended so the meat doesn’t turn to mush.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H.

customer_reviews.title: Will not need an Insta-Pot!
customer_reviews.text: My pressure cooker does the job and this crockpot does everything else! My pork roast was cooked to order -- a little more quickly than planned, but that's ok .. really ingenious .. there is also a Manual Setting and a Programmed Setting .. very slick .. will make my yogurt .. no, won't be needing the Insta-Pot!
customer_reviews.author: CrossposterJulie

customer_reviews.title: Top crockpot!
customer_reviews.text: After much research on looking for a programmable crockpot—and seeing this is one of the top rated ones, I made the purchase, and so glad that a I did! I love the outside look of it, the 3 options of: manual, programmable, and probe, and the lock feature for carrying/traveling. I’ve used it 3 times so far and plan on using it many more!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Minor probe placement issue, but overall GREAT unit!
customer_reviews.text: Love this slow cooker with one complaint...the location of the hole in the lid for the temperature probe. It needs to be closer to the center of the lid. I can't always get it placed where I want it in the meat and I don't want to move the meat, as that could cause uneven cooking. Would also like it if the temperature probe settings went lower. Other than those minor things, I've been using this slow cooker for nearly five years and never had any issues. I use it 4-7 times a month on average.
customer_reviews.author: FavoriteAuntie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after only using it 3 times.
customer_reviews.text: This slow cooker was used 3 times tops and on the last usage of it, it stopped working on me. We put some pork ribs in it and set it to cook. After returning home, it was cold. All of the lights were on but the meat and sauce that was in it was cold. Now I'm going to have to go through the hassle of trying to get a replacement one because it was just purchased at Christmas time. I hope the warranty department doesn't give me a hard time with replacement of it?
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Lid shattered
customer_reviews.text: Lid shattered after 3 months use. They say it's not under warranty and I can't even but a replacement lid as they don't have any. Not happy at all. I expect more from Hamilton Beach.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work!
customer_reviews.text: Dislike that is not usable! Hamilton Beach is going to send a label to us; and send a much smaller non programmable one back! Shame on you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooks too hot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the crock in my old crock pot kept cracking. I have not really liked it at all. It cooks extremely hot leaving food dry and/or burnt. The shell is really flimsy and will dent with the lightest touch. I’d rather purchase my old crock pot and just buy a new one every few years than stick with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary L Brown

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for our old one. It's actually a newer model and design. I was happy with the model we had and am even happier with this one. I love the cooking time to warm option. Plan on buying a couple more of these as early Christmas presents.
customer_reviews.author: El Jefé

customer_reviews.title: Finally a crock pot that works great
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding cooking performance and seal of the lid. If you travel, you can secure the lid so as not to spill in route. Austere minimum settings on timer, but good enough. Fancy ones break, so I am happy with good enough timer. Cooks to temp set very well. Would strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately just a little over a year old and of ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately just a little over a year old and of course "out of warranty" the side clip which holds the top on tight broke. It's made of cheap plastic. I didn't even do anything to make it break. I just went to clip it down and the plastic broke. Hamilton Beach will not replace. Crockpots should last years.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because my old crock pot didn't have a timer. This one works great. I've used the temperature probe and the timer modes. Both work great. Best feature is that when it's done cooking it automatically switches to warm.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Display started to peel off after using it once!
customer_reviews.text: Used it once and the display panel started lifting off. It's just a thin, flexible plastic display that is stuck with adhesive to the front of the machine. After one use it started to bubble and peel off. Contacted the seller but never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie K

customer_reviews.title: Good Programable Crockpot
customer_reviews.text: I really like this crockpot. I used it all winter to make chicken and stews. It can be programed to cook on high or low for a certain number of hours, then it switches to warm. It's a bit of and improvement over the same old 70s crocks.
customer_reviews.author: cindisart

customer_reviews.title: Odd Slow Cooker That Vents
customer_reviews.text: It took 3 tries to finally get one with a decent crock. The unit itself is not what I expected. The lid does not fit tightly on the crock and the lid itself has two venting holes, plus the hole for the temperature probe. So my minestrone turned out like thick stew because most of the liquid cooked off on low through all of the holes and poorly fitting lid. The instructions tell you not to cook with the latches on so that you don't damage the rubber gasket. This crock might be better for cooking roasts, but I haven't tried one yet.
customer_reviews.author: UB

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is very good, which completely conforms to the seller's description. I like it very much. This is completely unexpected. Solved my big trouble. This is a satisfactory shopping experience.
customer_reviews.author: J.S. McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Cooks chicken perfectly. The lock device seems a bit wobbly & the container is heavier to hold & clean, but great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Ally Crock-Pot are in storage due to a stop movement military move from the Rona and I desperately wanted to make some stuff in my crock pot. I got this one via the monthly payments and I absolutely love it. Exspecially the thermometer that came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Petty

customer_reviews.title: Poorly implemented
customer_reviews.text: You can use the temperature probe to turn off the heat at 150 degrees HOWEVER the "warm" temperature is about 160 degrees. This is the lowest temperature you can cook at.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Worked For One Month
customer_reviews.text: This was a very good slow cooker for one month - then the control knob would no longer toggle to any other temperature besides low and seemed very loose and not engaged. - of course two days after my return window closed!! We'll see what the manufacturer says! SO disappointing and inferior!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't boil your food (unless you want it to)
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Well built. Probe works perfectly, if you want to do a prime rib at 150, you can. Also, Low and High cook settings work like the old time ones, it does not boil your food. Nice job Hamilton Beach!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Skoviak

customer_reviews.title: I loved using my old crockpot for overnight oatmeal
customer_reviews.text: My one complaint is that you cannot set it to start cooking later. I loved using my old crockpot for overnight oatmeal. I would set an outlet timer (like you use to automatically turn on Christmas lights) to turn on the crockpot two hours before we wake up. Unfortunately, that's not an option with this slow cooker. The features it does have are great, though.
customer_reviews.author: UlrikeDG

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach Portable 6-Quart Set & Forget Digital Programmable Slow Cooker With Temperature Probe, Lid Lock, Stainless Steel (33969A)
product_meta.description:
Style:Temperature ProbeIn addition to offering modern convenience, the set & forget programmable slow cooker has three choices for easy, automatic cooking: program, probe and manual mode. On busy days, program the cooking time and set & forget slow cooker automatically shifts to keep warm when the cooking time is up. Cooking a large cut of meat like pot roast, chicken, or pork tenderloin? Insert the probe, set the desired meat temperature and the set & forget slow cooker automatically shifts to keep warm when the temperature is reached. For traditional slow cooking, manually select the high, low or warm temperature without setting a cooking time. Thermometer probe for precise results.

BRAND STORY
By Hamilton Beach
feature_bullets: Not your mom’s slow cooker: Smart technology allows you to cook a recipe to either a desired cooking time or specific temperature, before automatically switching to warm when it’s done
Patented temperature probe: Place the temperature probe into large cuts of meat to cook to a precise temperature the control panel will display the food’s exact temperature as it cooks
Clip-tight gasket lid: The lid clips securely in place, perfect for taking the slow cooker to a party, potluck or tailgate the tight seal helps prevent messy spills along the way
Easy to clean: Removable and dishwasher safe crock and glass lid make cleanup simple and power interrupt protection keeps slow cooker on during a brief power outage
6 quart capacity: Spacious size is perfect for a 6 pound chicken or 4 pound roast

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,806 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
